comment: This class was not easy, but the teacher was approachable, he answered any questions, but his expectations were quite clear. If you do your homework, attend class you should be fine. I would take his class again.
Really enjoyed this class! Interesting way of explaining but very clear.
Just study. Its a lot of studying but... thats the key.

He is the worst math teacher I have ever had in my life. I have made As in ever other math class but I am struggling to get a C. The last test average was a 46. He is a total jerk and completely useless in class. You might as well take the class online because he is no help at all. You would at least save your time if you took it online.

Nice man, bad teacher. All mathxl, no book work. Not helpful, choosy about wording. I did better on his exams if I didn't attend class. Also, tests are extremely difficult and often include questions that were never addressed in class or on mathxl. AVOID

Prof speaks downs to students, does not teach subject well. uses online MathXL no book work. Teaches (when he does) from power point slides from his computer to the white board. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS, VERY HARD!

Strongly DO NOT recommend. Prof. teaches as if you already know what he knows about Pre-Calc. More of a review on class days. Moves through material quickly and talks down to you if you ask questions. Self-study is a must! Two to three homework assignments for every class day.

Precal. The examples in class are okay, but Im really just barely able to learn and pass from the homework on mathXL. He's alright, but only if you already have a grasp on the subject AND you are willing to do tons of independent studying. You don't learn in the class, you just review really. Humor's not bad when he's not talking down on someone.

For 12 years I hated math, but after his class, I actually enjoy it!! I had him for College Algebra, and he explains everything VERY well, he is ALWAYS willing to help, and as long as you show up to class, you should get an A. He knows what he's talking about, and he knows how to explain it so that you can understand it. Amazing Prof!

What the heck. Idk who doesn't like this fellow. He's ridiculously energetic, extremely helpful, online hw is easy for the most part, tests aren't bad. He makes class very tolerable-cool guy to be around, very engaging

AVOID HIM. He does not teach. He knows his stuff but does not seem to know how to show others how to understand it. If you take him, you will need to live in the Math Lab for the semester. The college students there can teach you more than he will.

Had him for precalc. Gives a couple random in-class grades but they have little effect on your grade. All other work done on Mathxl. His tests were fair, I thought, but most failed them. I made an A, but barely.

DONT TAKE! Possibly my least favorite teacher ever. I'm decent at math and NEVER missed class, and am very disappointed with my grade. Easily learned more on MATH XL than from the teacher. Talks down to students. Not helpful. I really wanted to like him, but he just did not explain the concepts at all. ALL work on math XL homework to tests
HORRIBLE. doesnt teach. is picky about the way you say things. doesnt help. sweats a lot. you will fail unless your high school teacher was god.

Class is what you make of it. If you study, you schould be okay. Every assignment is thru the computer, so he does not take attendance. There are 4 exams and then the final. Online homework and quizzes count too.

Everything is on MathXl... no point in going to class he barely teaches anyway. I taught myself everything so far. He calls on students to answer questions and puts them on the spot. VERY STRICT about cell phones. I'd recommend someone else, if possible.

So far he's very fair and teaches well to help you understand. All work is done in MathXL, do the study plans and the tests are based from the homework/study plans in MathXL. He is serious about turning the cell phones off in his class but overall for a Math teacher he's pretty cool.
